Topic.Title: AMZN topped again at $283. It is going back to $260s again

Message.Msg: This stock is the favorite wall street along with that fella Elon Musk's tesla. They're obsessed with CEOs having vision of grandeur and are out there to "change the world". As I said before, this stock is about sentiment not fundamentals, it will only be a good short once the sentiment shift. I have no idea when they will pull the plug on this one perhaps when growth drop to the mid teens. Bezos is buying time with growth I figure that there still a few more slacks to cut. Many funds are probably doing a live or die with clients money on this stock. There's no where to run for Amazon once it break. Unlike Apple there is no earnings to back it up once the blood get spilled so the drop will be very fast like Netflix. But at this time Amazon is still the Moby #$%$ for shorts.

Message.Title: Tax, Tom-Foolery?
Message.Msg: If you watch Amazon, they used to carry nothing. They use computer metrics to keep track of what "real stores" carry that is hot. They then use their billions to swoop in and steal sales from "real stores." With little risk and all reward and collecting a 15 - 25% kickback on all the retail sold on their site, how in the world can they show losses quarter-after-quarter. They are either cooking books or they are as worthless as they look. I am still the old-school small business supporter and would never shop on their site, but I know many do.
